Chapter 7.question: Disruptive Technologies
options: Force companies to adapt their operations to stay competitive
Have entered the market but are not yet regularly used by companies
Are difficult to analyze using traditional software tools
May eventually become an emerging technologies
Chapter 7.answer: Force companies to adapt their operations to stay competitive

Chapter 7.question: When adopting new technologies, companies can safeguard their businesses from related risks by implementing policies and procedures and internal controls that identify, assess, and mitigate the risk. These include all of the following except
options: Establishing an emerging technology center of excellence as part of the organizational structure
Waiting to be one of the last companies to adopt a technology
Chapter 7.answer: Waiting to be one of the last companies to adopt a technology

Chapter 7.question: Emerging technologies
options: Have entered the market and are now regularly used by companies
Will be adopted by companies to stay competitive

Chapter 7.question: Which of the following is not an example of gamification?
options: Building graphics and video displays into simulations to teach wrookers about dangers at a factory
A competition among salespeople to earn points
Dressing up as a cow to promote a fast-food restaurant
Creating a game to teach students about managerial accounting
Chapter 7.answer: Dressing up as a cow to promote a fast-food restaurant

Chapter 7.question: Sprit line beverages sponsors a contest for its programmers, with prizes for the winning teams. This is an example of _____ that is intended to _____.
options: Online marketing, build social media data
Gamification, build motivation and team rapport
Chapter 7.answer: Gamification, build motivation and team rapport

Chapter 7.question: Which of the following statements about robotic process automation (RPA) is false?
options: Always performs programmed tasks in the same way

Chapter 7.question: Which of the following statements about Artificial Intelligence is false?
options: Enables programmed tasks to evolve through self learning
Performs tasks associated with intelligent beings

Chapter 7.question: Using principles of a feasibility study, including cost-benefit analysis, select the use case that is least feasible for robotic process automation (RPA). The RPA solution
options: Copies and pastes the prior years annual report disclaimer verbiage into the current years document
Reviews employee expense reimbursements and sends an email alert to finance employees for investigation upon detecting a red flag or fraud
Automatically retrieves and opens vendor invoices files received via email, identifies the key data in each invoice, and copies that data into the accounts payable system.
Automatically retrieves findings and recommendations directly from the internal audit system for each engagement and copies the text into a power point presentation
Chapter 7.answer: Copies and pastes the prior years annual report disclaimer verbiage into the current years document

Chapter 7.question: Which of the following is true?
options: Bitcoin trading is an example of robotic process automation

Chapter 7.question: Which underlying technology does blockchain not depend on?
Which statement about blockchain technology is false>
options: A record of a transaction cant be added to the blockchain without network consensus
A blockchain has nodes, which consist of the computers, laptops, or servers of all participants in the blockchain
Blockchain transactions can be updated at any time by participants in the blockchain
Blocks of ledgers are stored on nodes in the blockchain
Chapter 7.answer: Blockchain transactions can be updated at any time by participants in the blockchain

Chapter 7.question: Which statement about blockchain technology is false?
options: Participants need permission to join public blockchains
Public blockchains require proof of work
Chapter 7.answer: Participants need permission to join public blockchains

Chapter 7.question: Compared to traditional ledgers, blockchain systems have the following advantage from a data perspective:
options: Data retention: Backups of blockchain data are more restrictive
Data security: a majority of participants in a blockchain must engage in fraud malfeasance for the fraud to be successful
Data verification: blockchain transactions are approved by an accounting manager
Data integrity: a blockchain system relies on an object-oriented database for storage
Chapter 7.answer: Data security: a majority of participants in a blockchain must engage in fraud malfeasance for the fraud to be successful

Chapter 7.question: From the perspective of the accounting profession. A blockchain technology is:
options: A mature and widely accepted technology
A technology that requires trusted third-party intermediaries

Chapter 7.question: Anna wires money from her bank account to her brother Garin in Australia for a fee of $35. The role of her bank is that of
Business transformation through blockchain is likely to occur ____ and requires ____ adoption
Which of the following is an important outcome of the use of blockchain?

At mega-construction, secured payments are sent to suppliers as soon as materials are received and scanned. Many attributes of the received goods are also scanned and recorded immediately on receipt. The information is shared through a distributed ledger. Mega-Consutrction is likely using ____.

Chapter 8.question: Which of the following is a benefit of clear documentation of systems and processes?
options: Systemic repetition and consistency in operations
Chapter 8.answer: Systemic repetition and consistency in operations

Chapter 8.question: How an documentation benefit employees?
options: By increasing the time necessary to perform a task
By helping them understand what to do when faced with uncertainties or problems
By creating the need for additional oversight from management
By providing minimal information on the systems used
Chapter 8.answer: By helping them understand what to do when faced with uncertainties or problems

Chapter 8.question: What is the importance of a record retention plan?
options: Identifying documents to be maintained or destroyed
Keeping records with low importance to the organization
Chapter 8.answer: Identifying documents to be maintained or destroyed

Chapter 8.question: Which of the following is an example of an item that is captured in program documentation?

Sad Reginald wrote software for the Valencia Clown Revue. One fine day, however, having grown tired of computers and software, he became a juggler, fire eater, and fainting goat performer. After his departure, the Valencia Clown Revue was unable to maintain and upgrade the systems that Sad Reginald had written. The best control for preventing this failure would be:

Rose and McMullin, a regional accounting firm, has recently accepted a contract to audit On the Spot, Inc. a mobile vending service that provides vending machines for large events. On the Spot uses a computerized accounting system, portions of which were developed internally to integrate with a standard reporting system that was purchased from a consultant. What type of documentation would be most useful to the auditors in determining how the system as a whole is constructed?
What is the purpose of an entity relationship diagram (ERD)?
options: Showing an outline of the organization
Providing a graphical representation of tables and relationships
Showing the flow of data through the system
Chapter 8.answer: Providing a graphical representation of tables and relationships

Chapter 8.question: How do organizational charts help an organization?
options: They quickly transform data into information

Chapter 8.question: Auditors also refer to questionnaires as:
Which of the following is not a type of flowchart?
How can a flowchart help with the evaluation of controls?
How is a flowline represented in a flowchart?
options: As a line with an arrow
Chapter 8.answer: As a line with an arrow

Chapter 8.question: How is a connector represented in a flowchart?
options: As a line with an arrow

Chapter 8.question: What does the decision shape represent in a flowchart?
options: B) materials coming into or out of the process
C) Data used in the process

Chapter 8.question: What does a DFD represent?
options: Information flow within a process or system
Roles and responsibilities within a process
Chapter 8.answer: Information flow within a process or system

Chapter 8.question: Within a DFD, which level highlights the main system functions?
A data flow diagram helps a user understand
options: The sources of data in a system and the destinations of that data
The flow of documents through an organization
The processing steps in an AIS
The processing logic of application programs
Chapter 8.answer: The sources of data in a system and the destinations of that data

Chapter 14.question: What is the most widely used internation standard for IT governance?
Select the statement that is not true about COBIT 2019.
options: Its organizational focus is IT governance
It focuses on all controls for assessing risk and providing assurance throughout an organization
It is a living document that welcomes feedback
It has five domains and 40 control objectives
Chapter 14.answer: It focuses on all controls for assessing risk and providing assurance throughout an organization

Chapter 14.question: Which item is not an objective of the IT Evaluate, Direct, and Monitor domain?
options: Ensure IT governance framework setting and maintenance
Manage an IT system of internal control
Chapter 14.answer: Manage an IT system of internal control

Chapter 14.question: One important purpose of COBIT is to
options: Guide managers, users, and auditors in adopting best practices related to the management of information technology
Identify specific control plans that could be implemented to reduce the occurrence of fraud
Specify the components of an information system that should be installed in an e-commerce environment
Suggests the type of information should be made available for management decision making
Chapter 14.answer: Guide managers, users, and auditors in adopting best practices related to the management of information technology

Chapter 14.question: Which of these logical access controls relates to authorization rather than authentication?
Which of these access roles would you assign to the internal audit manager of a public company?
Eleanor Rigby’s Crematorium and Pest Custodian Services wants to choose the strongest control method for accessing its systems. They should choose:

When a client’s accounts payable computer system was relocated, the administrator provided support through the dial-up connection to a server. Subsequently, the administrator left the company. No changes were made to the accounts payable system at the time. Which of the following situations represents the greater security risks?
options: User passwords are not required to be in alphanumeric format
Management procedures for user accounts are not documented
User accounts are not removed upon the termination of employees
Security logs are not periodically reviewed for violations
Chapter 14.answer: User accounts are not removed upon the termination of employees

Chapter 14.question: Why did Amazon and Google choose not to build their new data centers near their headquarters?
options: They plan to leave those areas and relocate their headquarters

Chapter 14.question: A security guard opens the door to allow an authenticated person into the data center. A second person enters behind the first person without properly scanning through security. This method of circumventing physical access controls is called
Which of the following best characterizes the function of a physical access control?
options: Provides authentication of users attempting to log into the system
Separates unauthorized individuals from computer resources
Minimizes the risk of a power or hardware failure
Chapter 14.answer: Separates unauthorized individuals from computer resources

Chapter 14.question: The inside environment of a data center should include all of the following except
Which of these is not an advantage of a hot backup site?
options: It is the most affordable option
The data backup process is integrated into the site
There is an immediate ramp-up to operations\
Chapter 14.answer: It is the most affordable option

Chapter 14.question: A controller is developing a disaster recovery plan for a corporation’s computer systems. In the event of a disaster that makes the company’s facilities unusable, the controller has arranged for the use of an alternative location and the delivery of duplicate computer hardware to this alternative location. Which of the following recovery plans would best describe this arrangement?
Which is true of the differential backup strategy?
options: It has the slowest backup time
It backs up all data since the last full backup
It backs up only the new data since the most recent backup of any type
It uses the highest amount of storage space
Chapter 14.answer: It backs up all data since the last full backup

Chapter 14.question: Womping Wembley Corp maintains three sets of backups, which are updated monthly, weekly, and daily. This approach illustrates a
The three stages in a change management process, in consecutive order are

The user reviews the outcome of some code. If the outcome is accurate, the user approves the change. The IT analyst tests the functionality of the code and authorizes it. The analyst then documents the testing. What stage of the change management process does this describe?
Only _____ have access to the test environment.

Chapter 15.question: Which of the following scenarios is not an example of a behavioral fraud red flag?
options: Your coworker complains he didn’t get a large enough bonus this year and wont be able to afford his sons soccer registration
Your coworker dislikes your manager and regularly complains about her
Your coworker brags about buying a new house in one of the most expensive parts of town, where a lot of the company’s executives live
Your coworker never takes vacation days or sick days because nobody else could do his job right
Chapter 15.answer: Your coworker dislikes your manager and regularly complains about her

Chapter 15.question: Corruption fraud schemes include
options: Asset misappropriation, financial statement fraud, conflicts of interest, and illegal gratuities
Economic extortion, illegal gratuities, asset misappropriation, and expense reimbursement fraud
Asset misappropriation, bribery, stolen cash, billing schemes
Bribery, conflict of interest, economic extortion, and illegal gratuities
Chapter 15.answer: Bribery, conflict of interest, economic extortion, and illegal gratuities

Chapter 15.question: Which of these is not a component of fraud?
Which of the following is correct concerning a fraud risk factor?
options: Its presence indicates that the risk of fraud is high
It has been observed in circumstances where frauds has occurred
It always requires modification of planned audit procedures
It is also a material weakness in internal control
Chapter 15.answer: It has been observed in circumstances where frauds has occurred

Chapter 15.question: “The company is so large it wont event notice it” is a type of
The first behavioural element in the fraud triangle is
The element of the fraud triangle that a company has most influence over is
If perceived pressure and opportunity to commit fraud are high and personal integrity is low, then the risk of fraud is
The most difficult asset misappropriation fraud scheme to detect, because it leaves not starting point or audit trail for audits to investigate, is
An example of asset misappropriation scheme is
A major difference between skimming and cash larceny is that:
options: Skimming is on the books, while larceny is off the books
Skimming occurs after the cash has been entered into the accounting system, while larceny occurs before it is entered
Larceny involves expense reimbursement schemes, while skimming involves recording fictitious revenue
Larceny occurs after both the transaction and the cash have been entered into the accounting system, while skimming occurs without the transaction being entered into the system
Chapter 15.answer: Larceny occurs after both the transaction and the cash have been entered into the accounting system, while skimming occurs without the transaction being entered into the system

Chapter 15.question: The major classes of asset misappropriation are
options: Skimming, double dipping, and payroll fraud
Skimming, fraudulent disbursements, and vendor fraud

Chapter 15.question: Which of the following is an example of fraudulent financial reporting?
options: Company management changes inventory count tags and overstates ending inventory while understating COGS
The treasurer diverts customer payments to his personal bank account, concealing his actions by debiting an expense account, thus overstating expenses
An employee steals inventory, and the shrinkage is recorded in COGS
An employee steals small tools from the company and neglects to return them, the cost is reported and miscellaneous operating expense
Chapter 15.answer: Company management changes inventory count tags and overstates ending inventory while understating COGS

Chapter 15.question: An example of a pressure to commit financial statement fraud is
options: Personal habits such as gambling or drug use
An employee bearing a grudge against the employer
Unreasonable performance metrics set by management
Reasonably expecting the fraud to go undetected
Chapter 15.answer: Unreasonable performance metrics set by management

Chapter 15.question: A fraud committed to lessen the amount of earings that will be teaxedd this year is an example of
options: Financial statement fraud that understates the company’s performance
Financial statement fraud that overstates company’s performance
Skimming cash before it is recorded in the company’s accounting books
Chapter 15.answer: Financial statement fraud that understates the company’s performance

Chapter 15.question: The fraud in which a company inflates its sales revenue by forcing more products through a distribution channel than the channel is capable of selling is called

Chapter 16.question: In 2017, Equifax made global news when hackers
options: Used Trojan horses to access its networks
Held a system hostage for ransom
Accessed financial data of millions of Americans
Deleted millions of records containing customer data
Chapter 16.answer: Accessed financial data of millions of Americans

Chapter 16.question: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Agency (CISA) recommends that companies facing cyberattacks that include ransom demands
options: Refuse to pay to discourage future attacks
Pay immediately to protect public interests
Consult lawyers before negotiating with criminals
Consult NIST 800-53 for guidelines on negotiations
Chapter 16.answer: Refuse to pay to discourage future attacks

Chapter 16.question: Cyberattacks are
options: Addressed in the original COSO pronouncements

Chapter 16.question: Managing cyber risks requires
options: Blocking all cyber breaching by relying on preventive controls
Blocking all cyber breaching by relying on detective and corrective controls
Attempting to prevent cyber breaching but addressing those that occur through detective and corrective controls
Attempting to prevent cyber breaching but addressing those that occur through preventive controls
Chapter 16.answer: Attempting to prevent cyber breaching but addressing those that occur through detective and corrective controls

Chapter 16.question: Who plays a pivotal role in a comapnys cybersecurity program?

The IT department at Piggy Parts BBQ has recently learned of phishing attempts that rely on social engineering to break into its financial system. Information abou these attempts should be communicated to
Which of the following is not a method of attack used in the process of a full cyberattack?
Which type of attack do network administrators not have control over preventing?
Incorrect sender addresses are red flags indicating possible
_____ identifies active IP addresses, while ____ identifies the types of communication occurring on the network.
An auditor was examining a client’s network and discovered that the users did not have password protection. Which of the following would be the best example of a strong network password?
In ____ tailgating, the authorized user holds the door open for the tailgater
The difference between eavesdropping and on-path attacks is that eavesdropping is _____ the communication, and an on-path attack is _____the communication.
IP spoofing disguises the ____ source address with the _____ IP address.
A company’s web server has been overwhelmed with a sudden surge of false requests that caused the server to crash. The company has most likely been the target of

Which of the following is true of about denial-of-service- attacks?
I. A denial of service attack takes advantage of a network communications protocol to tie up the server’s communication ports so that legitimate users cannot gain access to the server.
II. If the denial-of-service attack is successful, the attacker can gain access to unprotected resources on the server.
Which of the following is a computer program that appears to be legitimate but performs an illicit action when it is run?
Which of the following is not one of the ways tha the Equifax hackers hid their suspicious network activity?
options: Purchased subscriptions to Equifax’s third-party software service
Created profiles using Equifax employee credentials
Purchases remote computing services from other countries
Blended into normal activity within an encrypted communication channels
Chapter 16.answer: Purchased subscriptions to Equifax’s third-party software service

Chapter 16.question: IP spoofing is often used as part of which of the following?
What is the primary difference between a virus and a worm?
options: Viruses require human interaction, but worms replicate without assistance
Viruses must be activated before a worm can replicate
Viruses are only effective on windows operating systems
Viruses are a type of malware, but worms are a type of denial-of-service attack3
Chapter 16.answer: Viruses require human interaction, but worms replicate without assistance
